modules.description: Provides access to a mutable transport layer, enabling dynamic changes to communication channels during execution. Works with the Transport.t data type, which encapsulates low-level network or inter-process communication details. Used to adjust connection settings at runtime without restarting the application.

Provides functions to manage and inspect type information in an application's context, including accessing and modifying a mutable type identifier. Works with the `typ` data type, which represents type metadata. Used to track and alter type definitions during runtime analysis or transformation processes.

Processes JSON strings into associative arrays using a parser that handles nested structures. Extracts and modifies values within these arrays through key-based accessors and mutators. Enables configuration management by reading and updating structured data from external files.

Handles real-time message updates and state management using a mutable string variable. Operates on simple string data to support dynamic content rendering. Used in interactive applications to display and modify status messages during execution.

Provides operations to manage input and output channels for network communication, including reading from and writing to a socket. Works with in_channel and out_channel types to handle data flow. Used to establish and control communication sessions in networked applications.

Handles framed network communication by managing read and write buffers, allowing precise control over byte stream segmentation. Operates on bytes and strings to process data in fixed-size frames. Used to implement protocol layers that require message boundaries to be explicitly defined and parsed.

Handles socket creation, binding, and listening for incoming connections using Unix file descriptors. Manages socket lifecycle operations such as opening, closing, and checking connection status. Used to establish server-side communication channels in networked applications.

Provides operations for reading and writing binary data, including a function to extract a single byte from a byte sequence. Works with byte arrays and binary-encoded data structures. Used to parse network packets and serialize structured data for transmission.

Provides functions to manage the state of a communication channel, including checking if it is open and handling data transmission. Works with boolean flags and binary data structures. Used to control and monitor the lifecycle of network connections in real-time messaging systems.
